com.test.pool
Interface BlockingPool<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to pool.
All Superinterfaces:
Pool<T>
public interface BlockingPool<T>
extends Pool<T>

Represents a pool of objects that makes the requesting threads wait if no object is available.

Author:
Swaranga

Methods inherited from interface com.test.pool.Pool
release, shutdown
 

Method Detail

get

T get()
Returns an instance of type T from the pool. The call is a blocking call, and client threads are made to wait indefinitely until an object is available. The call implements a fairness algorithm that ensures that a FCFS service is implemented. Clients are advised to react to InterruptedException. If the thread is is interrupted while waiting for an object to become available, the current implementations set the interrupted state of the thread to true and returns null. However this is subject to change from implementation to implementation.

Specified by:
get in interface Pool<T>
Returns:
T an instance of the Object of type T from the pool.

get

T get(long time,
      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Returns an instance of type T from the pool, waiting up to the specified wait time if necessary for an object to become available.. The call is a blocking call, and client threads are made to wait for time until an object is available or until the timeout occurs. The call implements a fairness algorithm that ensures that a FCFS service is implemented. Clients are advised to react to InterruptedException. If the thread is is interrupted while waiting for an object to become available, the current implementations set the interrupted state of the thread to true and returns null. However this is subject to change from implementation to implementation.

Parameters:
time - amount of time to wait before giving up, in units of unit
unit - a TimeUnit determining how to interpret the timeout parameter
Returns:
T an instance of the Object of type T from the pool.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting
